snippet: A judge invalidated new restrictions on sweetened beverages on Monday, saying the rules were “arbitrary and capricious.”
abstract: Justice Milton A Tingling Jr of State Supreme Court in Manhattan strikes down  New York City's limits on large sugary drinks, one day before they were to take effect;  it is a significant blow to one of the most ambitious and divisive initiatives of Mayor Michael R Bloomberg’s tenure; judge calls limits 'arbitrary and capricious,'  echoing the complaints of city business owners and consumers who had deemed the rules unworkable and unenforceable, with confusing loopholes and voluminous exemptions.

byline.contributor: Michael Barbaro, David W. Chen and Kate Taylor contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A judge invalidated new restrictions on sweetened beverages on Monday, saying the rules were “arbitrary and capricious.”

headline.seo: Judge Invalidates Bloomberg’s Ban on Sugary Drinks
headline.main: Judge Blocks New York City’s Limits on Big Sugary Drinks
headline.print_headline: Court Halts Ban On Large Sodas In New York City
